dcterms:creator: M. Chavira
A. Darwiche
dcterms:description: Weighted Model Counting (WMC) is a reasoning task on propositional knowledge bases that extends model counting by assigning weights to models and computing the sum of these weights.
dcterms:title: Weighted Model Counting (WMC)

dcterms:creator: M. Chavira
A. Darwiche
dcterms:description: Probabilistic Graphical Models are used to describe dependencies between random variables and define joint density functions compactly.
dcterms:title: Probabilistic Graphical Models

dcterms:creator: D. Suciu
D. Olteanu
C. RÃ©
C. Koch
dcterms:description: Probabilistic Databases provide a framework for managing uncertain data and performing probabilistic queries.
dcterms:title: Probabilistic Databases

dcterms:creator: P. P. Shenoy
J. C. West
dcterms:description: Hybrid Bayesian Networks allow for inference using mixtures of polynomials, extending traditional Bayesian networks to handle hybrid domains.
dcterms:title: Hybrid Bayesian Networks

dcterms:creator: C. W. Barrett
R. Sebastiani
S. A. Seshia
C. Tinelli
dcterms:description: Satisfiability Modulo Theories (SMT) extends classical SAT to allow reasoning about first-order formulas with respect to decidable background theories.
dcterms:title: Satisfiability Modulo Theories (SMT)

dcterms:creator: A. Darwiche
dcterms:description: Sentential Decision Diagrams (SDDs) are a canonical representation of propositional knowledge bases that support efficient probabilistic inference.
dcterms:title: Sentential Decision Diagrams (SDDs)

dcterms:creator: P. Morettin
A. Passerini
R. Sebastiani
dcterms:description: Exact Probabilistic Inference refers to methods that compute probabilities exactly using weighted model integration.
dcterms:title: Exact Probabilistic Inference

dcterms:creator: R. I. Bahar
E. A. Frohm
C. M. Gaona
G. D. Hachtel
E. Macii
A. Pardo
F. Somenzi
dcterms:description: Algebraic Decision Diagrams (ADDs) are a data structure used for representing Boolean functions and have applications in various fields including formal verification.
dcterms:title: Algebraic Decision Diagrams

dcterms:creator: P. Martires
A. Dries
L. De Raedt
dcterms:description: Piecewise Polynomial Densities are used in probabilistic inference to represent complex distributions and facilitate exact and approximate weighted model integration.
dcterms:title: Piecewise Polynomial Densities
